title: Can we please give Mordekaiser his health regen back?
body:
This is a champion that uses _health_ as a resource and has _no_ forms of natural sustain, while being weak as shit early.

His regen is literally just 0.1 higher than Riven's....why? Why is he literally forced to waste 1200 gold so he doesnt kill himself in lane?

Sure, he has a shield, but the only way to keep that shit up is by striking at least 3 minions on a single spell whenever it is off-CD....which pushes the fuck out of the lane. If you back off (Like you should, because Mordekaiser is literal gank bait), the shield will be down and you will have even less HP than the other guy anyway.

Meanwhile the likes of Riven just needs to use 800 gold to sit in lane forever and has a free shield every few seconds. Meanwhile Rumble's shield has a 5 seconds CD and no resources (And still has better regen than Mord).


Meanwhile Aatrox, Vlad, Rengar, Tryndamere, Nidalee all have healing spells (With only Nid's costing mana, but thats offset by her having three free skills, including a 5 seconds CD dash). Even the ones that need to hit minions to sustain (Such as Aatrox and Vlad) only need to hit one minion at a time, so they dont push the lane anywhere near as hard.

replies.body: Agreed. He has a lower health regen then almost anyone in the game, for no real reason. The other day my lane opponent was afk and I still managed to lose a fourth of my health just by csing. It's really frustrating when the squishy mage I'm up against is healing up faster then I can. He used to have regen of 8. But when he got his "compensation" it got lowered to 3.
That reason being so he can't be such a bully in lane anymore. If you were any good at him before the update, you'd know what im talking about.

yeah, he was a bully before, but taking away 63% of his base health regen for *minuscule* health cost buffs is terrible design. If you want to nerf his early game pressure, nerf the strength of his early game shield (which is what made him a lane bully), not his resource *and* only sustain.

The thing is the change wasn't to prevent him from being a lane bully per-se.  It was to make his bullying lane risky, the same reason they gave Riven a low health regen.  He has the tools to trade hard and force allot of opponents out of lane but he pays for it in the fact that he can't really recover if he screws up.

He has the tools to trade hard and force allot of opponents out of lane but he pays for it in the fact that he can't really recover if he screws up.

But both Riven and Mordekaiser are different champs, and can't really be compared. Mordekaiser has no mobility, it is much easier for him to screw up because he doesn't have the mobility to force disengages or dodge pokes or escape from ganks.


Also, if the reason is that he is such a huge lane bully, why then Darius is allowed to have super high health regeneration? He is too a lane bully, and is arguably much more of a lane bully when compared to Mordekaiser, especially against melee champions not named Yorick.

Riven deals high damage and has mobility, hard cc, and a pretty crap shield to avoid damage with.  Mord has higher damage and a much stronger shield to avoid damage with.  Their goals and play pattern IN LANE are similar even if their tools are different.  

They both want to force allot of trades.  Riven dashes in, knocks you up, hits you, and dashes back out to deal damage to you and get away with little retaliation.  Mord e's you, q's you, and has so much shield he can walk away and you can't stick any damage to him.

Mind you, I could be wrong in my understanding of Riven.  I don't actually play her, I'm just going off of what I know about her.
90/120/150/180/210+100% of bonus AD is not crap
still, it could stand to be raised slightly, to maybe 5 per 5
meanwhile rumble has 3,5 health regen/second with dorans shield at lvl 1 with recourceless skills and a free shield every 5 (?) seocnds

for hardly any actual damage and they usually cant speed up and shield them self while chasing with a flame thrower at the same time

Is his ultimate not considered incredibly powerful CC, zone-denial, and damage? Or are slows no longer considered CC anymore?

Morde is a mess right now. Riot wants him to build tanky, but he has no CC and low base damage. He can't really be a mage anymore either because they crushed his AP ratios across the board, and they weren't great to begin with (hence his utter reliance on DFG). They obviously shouldn't give him CC, and in my opinion, his role should be the mage you just can't kill. His kit should be oriented heavily towards DPS (lower cooldowns across the board) to keep his shield up consistently, but his burst should be minimized and his kit left clearly as a persistent damage source. Tanks who's sole job is to attack the enemy team with all they've got (like Mundo and Shyvana) have worked before and still do, and making Morde a DPS sustain tank would be perfect.

Morde should be the champ who you really can't fight in the open, but who also has the clear weakness of not being hard to run away from. His presence should be a deterrent in and of itself, but if you play it right, the counter effect is simply to bypass his immobility and lack of CC to kill his allies. Treating Morde this way is a tricky thing, since if he is too strong he becomes a low counterplay champion murdering machine, but if he is too undertuned, he becomes an ignorable pest at worst, but it is really his core identity. He is the paladin of pain, a durable, persistent threat who will kill you slowly if you fight him and who's greatest counter is simply fleeing in terror (or in the case of League, out rotating and catching out his allies).

My ideas for how to change him are pretty simple:

Passive: Max shield values adjusted to 50 (+25 per level) (+8% HP) from 90 (+30 per level). This reduces the base shield at level 1 by 1 health without runes, masteries, or items. At level 18 it reduces the base by 130, but the health scaling increases the total by 153 (net increase of 23) with only base health. This allows a tankier Morde a little more room to breathe late game if he opts into a little health in his items, without drastically changing the scaling of a non tanky Morde.

Q: Base damage and scalings increased to 70/110/150/190/230 (+50% AP) (+100% Bonus AD) (up from 80/110/140/170/200 (+40% AP) (+100% Bonus AD)) and the bonus for hitting only one target adjusted to deal 50% more damage, or 105/165/225/285/345 (+75% AP) (+150% Bonus AD) (up from 132/181.5/231/280.5/330 (+66% AP) (+165% Bonus AD)) These changes shift his power slightly away from his early game damage in favor of better AoE and slightly improved single target damage late game, while also reducing the amount of his power budget sen on an absurdly high bonus AD ratio.

W: Bonus armor and MR changed to 9 (+2 per level) (11-45) from 10/15/20/25/30. Damage changed to also deal 10% combined armor+mr damage per second, for a total of up to 60% armor+MR damage (damage calculated before cast, the stat bonuses it gives are not factored in). AP ratio unchanged. Base damage changed to 14/26/38/50/62 (total 84/156/228/300/372) from 20/32/44/56/68 (total 120/192/264/336/408) (at level 1 he deals slightly less, and at 18 he deals 7.78 more damage per second, or 46.68 more damage total with no items)

E: Cooldown changed to 6/5.5/5/4.5/4 seconds from 6. Base damage lowered to 75/115/155/195/235 from 70/115/160/205/250. AP ratio reduced to 55% from 60%, Health cost adjusted to 24/35/46/57/68 from 24/36/48/60/72.

R: unchanged.

these changes generally are nerfs to his early game damage and buffs to his alts game, while also encouraging a build centered around a mix of sustain, HP, resists, and AP. With these changes, it would be safe to bump Morde's base HP5 back up to around 6 without making him an oppressive lane bully again.

I agree with everything that you said, except the part that you said that Mordekaiser has low base damage. His base damage is really high to be honest. I play him as an AP bruiser with magic penetration, and it works wonders.

Here is my build for Mordekaiser on most games:

{{item:3152}} {{item:3158}} {{item:3001}} {{item:3151}}, {{item:3065}} or {{item:3116}}, and then either {{item:3157}} or {{item:3075}}. If the enemy team is full AD, I use Zhonya instead of Abyssal Scepter. I can swap {{item:3158}} for {{item:3020}} if I am using CDR glyphs, this allows me to deal more damage and still maximize CDR. {{item:3111}} is also an option if the enemy team has too much CC.

The idea is that Mordekaiser's bases are very high, so I use a build with a lot of flat magic penetration and cooldown reduction. Liandry is also used not only because of the flat magic penetration, but also because of the passive, allowing Mordekaiser do deal with champions late game that tend to have high health pools.

I also use AP items that give resistances or health, allowing Mordekaiser to be tanky while still doing a lot of damage.

Spirit Visage is used for the extra sustain with WotA and his ult, and to patch up his low natural health regeneration. Thornmail is used if the enemy team has a lot of dangerous auto-attacks, and works wonders with his shield. But Zhonya is also an option. It allows Mordekaiser to deal more damage and is recommended if the enemy team has dangerous spells such as Zed's and Karthus' ults. Rylai is a viable option over Spirit Visage to solve Mordekaiser's problem of lacking CC, it also allow him to stick to his targets, while also doubling Liandry's passive damage, allowing Mordekaiser to slowy murder enemies that dare getting close to him.

I'm actually more a fan of Gunblade over WotA on Morde ever since they buffed it to have 80 AP.

The AD and lifesteal it gives isn't bad either since Morde actually has one of the highest base attack speeds in the game at level 18, and 40 bonus AD gives his Q an extra 66 damage, which is nothing to scoff at if you are getting the sustain anyway.

I will agree. I believe that, especially after the WotA changes, if you want Morde to sustain himself it's most likely better to grab a gunblade. The ranged slow may not be much, but on a champion that has no cc and very little mobility it's nothing to sneeze at.

to be fair, for a tank/caster based fighter, his abilities are low damage. The nearest comparison in the game right now is Rumble.

He has no health costs and similar CDs, but:

Q deals 115 more base damage un-enhanced, 142 more while enhanced, not to mention having more than 2 times the AP ratio.

W's shield is weaker than a max strength Morde shield unless Rumble has 937 AP, *but* Rumble's shield also offers MS and is on a short cooldown where Morde relies on actually dealing damage to generate his shield, so it isn't strictly better than Rumble's.

Rumble's E can deal almost twice the damage of Morde's E if in the danger zone, not even considering having up to twice the AP ratio and a hefty slow to boot.

For Rs, both are DoT effects, but rumble's has a massive AoE and a slow, while Morde's takes longer to deal its damage, is single target, and requires the target to have something between about 3800 and 3400 HP for it to even deal the same damage as Rumble's ult based on how much AP he has.

The only things Morde has over Rumble are his ghost, and he doesn't even deal enough damage to get a ghost reliably anymore. He needs buffs *badly*.

{{champion:36}}: Literally gets healed for a % of his Max HP simply for existing. No player interaction with his Passive whatsoever.

I'm in the midst of becoming a Mordekaiser main, so I have a couple of things to point out here.

1. You're completely right, his regen is shit, and needs to be at around a 4.5 in order to be a valid pick for people who aren't proficient with him.

2. Like I said -  *proficient*. Honestly, I stomp my lanes with him consistently, because of his shield and healing from ult at the last second. He really doesn't NEED this buff, I'd much rather give him a slow on his E, or consistent MS on his W than have health regen, but I can completely see him using this type of a buff to become a valid pick at higher elo's.

3. Play him for a while, get good at *farming via auto's* and you'll be able to manage him well. Just practice last hitting with auto's, and only push lane when you're playing against a laner who likes to roam (Leblanc, Katarina, Twisted fate, etc...), that way they can't leave lane without losing mid/top early.

4. Finally, after 98% of my games with him, I get the same thing: "Wow, that shield is BS... Morde is so OP." This right here is EXACTLY why he isn't OP. Really, he isn't as safe of a pick as Riven (with two dashing abilities, and two abilities with hard CC), but if you can manage your pushing power+shield, you can win lane easily, even without the health regen buff. 

Just remember one tiny, simple tip: after getting spellvamp, when pushing wave or taking raptors: E, THEN Q. I see so many people getting this wrong. If you want to heal more health than you lose, DO NOT USE Q FIRST. E the wave, Q the wave, that's 5 farm and you lost no health.

EDIT: I forgot, if we keep making "Buff morde" threads, RIot might, then he won't be my secret weapon anymore, and people might actually know what his abilities do. Just pointing that out{{champion:82}}

That's hilarious. Go and play Mordekaiser and watch how much of an issue his health costs are early. Once you get his E to level 5, it costs 72 health...

The idea is that you convert your Health into shield. You're not losing Health, you're gaining it. But, you have to actually use it by putting yourself at risk, instead of sitting back farming like every other manaless ranged champ does. I don't think Morde is compensated enough for having to make that sacrifice though, but similarly to how mana champions can buy a Mana item, you can buy Spellvamp to mitigate your weakness. Morde could definitely use some changes, but that's why his Regen is low.

If you want to buff Mordekaiser he needs to actually be reworked from the ground up, he isn't exactly a complex champion, and his passive makes balancing him difficult to do.
